title: Ticket #1439: GetEnv() of the Env object returns an invalid char pointer
description:
GetEnv() function: 
const char *
Env::GetEnv(MyString const &var) const
{
	MyString val;
	// lookup returns 0 on success
	if ( _envTable->lookup(var,val) == 0 ) {
		return val.Value();
	} else {
		return NULL;
	}
}

The memory pointed to by val.Value() is invalid after this function call.

Here are the call sites I found: 

condor_c++_util/proc_family_proxy.cpp:107:      const char* base_addr_from_env = GetEnv("CONDOR_PROCD_ADDRESS_BASE");

condor_gridmanager/gt42_gahp_wrapper.cpp:118:   const char *port_range = GetEnv( "GLOBUS_TCP_PORT_RANGE" );
condor_gridmanager/gt4_gahp_wrapper.cpp:118:    const char *port_range = GetEnv( "GLOBUS_TCP_PORT_RANGE" );
condor_master.V6/master.cpp:727:        if ( GetEnv("GCB_INAGENT") ) {
condor_master.V6/master.cpp:1125:       const char *our_broker = GetEnv( "GCB_INAGENT" );
condor_master.V6/master.cpp:1255:       if ( GetEnv("GCB_INAGENT") ) {
condor_master.V6/master.cpp:1262:       if ( GetEnv("GCB_INAGENT") &&
condor_starter.V6.1/baseStarter.cpp:238:        if ( GetEnv( "CONDOR_GLEXEC_STARTER_CLEANUP_FLAG" ) ) {
remarks:
2010-Jun-09 15:03:58 by gthain:
Note the source code is for the member function Env::GetEnv, and the call sites are all for ::GetEnv.

2010-Jun-09 16:03:28 by psilord:
This does bring into light that we still have two methods of dealing with environments, the En object as described in condor_c++_util/env.cpp and the SetEnv() and GetEnv() interface, as described in condor_c++_util/setenv.cpp.

I remember we were trying to unify/replace everything with the Env object and I guess the transition fizzled out.
